_header: An Emperor was once in Rome / That was righteous in his doom
Subjects: Gregory, saint; Jews; Alexander, king; Trajan, emperor; exempla
_description: Gregory and Trajan’s soul, followed by the story of Alexander and the imprisoned Jews, in the Northern Homily Cycle — in couplets

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
ȝe may heyr now be a taleþat I to yow now tell
                    sale…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…þat we may at our lyfys endVnto þe Ioy of heuyn
                    wend
BodSelSup52.Note: Seventeen couplets: Gregory and Trajan only.

BodAsh42.First Lines:
Ane Emperoure was wonand in romeþat was rightwise in his
                    dome…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…Amen amen saye we all samenþat we may come to ioye &
                    gammen
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
AN Emperour was onus In Roomeþat was ful rihtwys in his
                    dome…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þat we may at vre liues endeIn to þe blisse of
                    heuene wende. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title: Hou Gregory preyde for a dampned man (f. 211ra)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Die Evangelien-Geschichten der Homiliensammlung des Ms. Vernon.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         57 (1877): 241-316: 306-7.

BLHar2391.First Lines: AN emperour was wonand in romeþat was reghwys in hys dome…
BLHar2391.Last Lines: …Amen Amen say we all sameþat we nay cum to Ioy & game
BLHar2391.Attributed Title: Dominica xix (left margin, f. 222) with “A tale” written below
